Dorothy Dottie Marbach and Rick Cotterman 4th SUNDAY of ADVENT DECEMBER 24 2017 YR THE DICE IS CAST DO NOT BE AFRAID TRUST GOD FOR HE HAS FOUND FAVOR WITH YOU My dear brothers and sisters in Christ I say peace be with you all Today is the 4th Sunday of advent the last Sunday before the Day Christmas Day We have been pre paring and we should continue to prepare in anticipation for the birth of Christ though the Day is tomorrow NB 1 Please pay attention for the fulfillment of the days of Obligation Sunday and Christmas You need to attend Sunday Mass and Christmas Mass separately These Masses are for Sunday Vigil Mass by 5:00pm on Saturday December 23 and the two Masses 730 and 10:00am on December 24 For Christmas Vigil Mass on Sunday December 24 by 5:00pm Night Mass by 1000 and 9:00am on Monday December 25 However you can attend Sunday Vigil Mass by 5:00pm to fulfill Sunday Obligation then you MUST attend either night Mass by 10:00pm or 9:00am Mass on Christmas Day for Christmas Obligation The Vigil Mass on Sunday December 24 by 5:00pm CANNOT suffice for both Sunday and Christmas Obligations I hope it is clear This is Churchs instruction 2 I will be going on my annual vacation I leave on 12262017 and come back on 212018 Be assured I will pray for you all Thanks for your own prayers for my safe journey to and from May God continue to protect and bless you all 3 As the year come to an end remember that we plan for Pilgrimage to the Holy Land next year to join in the Foot Steps of Our Lord Jesus Christ So consider seriously of joining us to the home land of Jesus Christ our Redeemer and Mes siah You will never regret going It will help you to understand more vividly the Scripture passages It is from April 23 to May 2 2018 In the first reading 2 Sam 715 6b12 14a16 David full of good will wanted to build a houseChurchTemple for God but instead God promised and built a kingdom for him You see in a desire to give God God gives us It is in giving gifts to God that we receive gifts from him It is in preparing for Gods coming that God will prepare a place for us Listen Christmas is such an important event to come Celebrate it very well Thus St Paul tells us in the second reading Rm 162527 that In Christmas in Christ God revealed the mystery He kept secret for ages past for a long time ago In our time he has revealed it in Christ He gave us the image of himself in his Son Christ Jesus an image we can perceive with our weak human senses Christmas is a yearly momentous event for those who are expecting the Emmanuel God is with us in faith and wonderment Then in the Gospel Lk 12638 just read the angel Gabriel which means the Strength of God was sent by God to Galilee and he greeted Virgin Mary The greet ing disturbed her because the work Hail is an attribute of divinity She was given the most difficult message ever given to a human person Behold you will conceive in your womb and bear a son and you shall name him Jesus Mary said to the angel How can this be since I have no relations with a man The angel assured her that God will take care of everything She trusted God and accepted the impossible task and the impossible became possible She said Let it be done to me according to your word Mary consented And immediate conception took place in her womb By trust ing in God she said Yes to God This yes the Church is asking us to say to God in our lives It is a million yes a billion yes and a trillium yes As Mary welcomed the son of God Jesus Christ in her womb so too let us welcome him in our hearts Hearts free from sin free from hatred jealousy calumny Gossip but hearts full of love kindness forgiveness Let us also welcome him in our midst in our homes and in our community The Yes of Our Lady Mary in the Gospel fulfilled the promise God made to our ancestors and to us through David that his own flesh will be the heir who will take seat and sit on his throne and that his kingdom will have no end Let us my dear brothers and sisters in Christ say yes to God in all things in our lives as Mary did God bless you Fr Pius Ilechukwu NB Heaven is for us all I hope you are doing something about it The amount needed each week to make budget is 511640 We are 240 behind budget from last week Other Collections within our Parish St Vincent de Paul Fund 15400 Diocesan Special Collections Religious Retirement 32700 Catholic Mass Times Mon Jan 1 2018 Mass 9:00am Not a Holy Day of Obli gation this year Sun Jan 7 The Epiphany of the Lord Epiphany Brunch immediately following 10:00am Mass Everyone is invited From Death To New Life In your charity please pray for the repose of the soul of Betty Kistler mother of Carmie Anderson died Monday December 18 2017 May God welcome her home Fill her with peace and bless those who will miss her Eternal Rest Grant unto her Lord and let Perpetual light shine upon her May her soul and the souls of all the faithful departed through the mercy of God rest in Peace Amen SCRIPTUREMASS 8th Annual Diocesan Mens Conference Fully ALIVE Saturday February 24 2018 at the Allen County War Memorial Coliseum Registration Forms are on the bulletin board in the narthex please help yourself to one HELPING HANDS PREGANCY RESOURCE CENTER Baby Bottle Campaign Baby Bottles will be passed out at all the Masses on the weekend of Jan 6th 7th for donations to Helping Hands Pregnancy Resource Cen ter Please take one home and fill it with change dollar bills or checks made out to Helping Hands Pregnancy Re source Center These donations will be used to help mothers who have chosen life for their babies but may find it hard to provide everything these babies need Helping Hands provides Pregnancy Tests Ultrasounds Baby Clothes Baby Supplies and Maternity Clothes They have Family Life Groups Mom Time Groups Man to Man Groups a Bereavement Group and a Smoking Cessation Program for parents who are expecting Please donate and help Women Men and their Families make LifeAffirming decisions that
